p: The chest x-ray remarks of a suspected coronavirus case can be similar to pneumonia (Jacobi et al. 2020). Severe cases of COVID-19 progressing to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) can show a typical “white-out” on chest x-ray (Venugopal et al. 2020). There are no specific echocardiography/ultrasound findings associated with coronavirus infection (Zheng et al. 2020). Non-specific echocardiographic findings can include left ventricular systolic dysfunction and pericardial effusion (Pérez-Casares et al. 2017). Chest CT scan findings in patients infected with coronavirus can include unilateral or bilateral pneumonia, mottling and ground glass opacity, focal or multifocal opacities, consolidation, and septal thickening with sub-pleural and lower lobe involvement more likely (Wu et al. 2020).
